source.class:
* Do not cache instances of this class! The methods {@linkplain BigAggregator#getCollection()},{@linkplain ComplexAggregator#getCollection()} and {@linkplain PrimitiveAggregator#getCollection()}return threadlocal instances, and when you access the individual * aggregators they are {@linkplain AggregatorFunction#reset()} for you. apete
<method name="cardinality" type="AggregatorFunction" startLine="38" endLine="41" />
* Count of non-zero elements
<method name="largest" type="AggregatorFunction" startLine="43" endLine="46" />
* Largest absolute value
<method name="maximum" type="AggregatorFunction" startLine="48" endLine="51" />
* Max value
<method name="minimum" type="AggregatorFunction" startLine="53" endLine="56" />
* Min value
<method name="norm1" type="AggregatorFunction" startLine="58" endLine="61" />
* Equivalent to, but probably faster than, norm(1);
<method name="norm2" type="AggregatorFunction" startLine="63" endLine="66" />
* Equivalent to, but probably faster than, norm(2);
<method name="product" type="AggregatorFunction" startLine="68" endLine="71" />
* Running product
<method name="product2" type="AggregatorFunction" startLine="73" endLine="76" />
* Running product of squares
<method name="smallest" type="AggregatorFunction" startLine="78" endLine="81" />
* Smallest non-zero absolute value
<method name="sum" type="AggregatorFunction" startLine="83" endLine="86" />
* Running sum
<method name="sum2" type="AggregatorFunction" startLine="88" endLine="91" />
* Running sum of squares
